decks.notes: The main concept of this Ruby Storm deck is to cast a high number of spells in a single turn to generate a massive amount of mana and overwhelm the opponent with a combo finisher like Grapeshot. Key cards like Ruby Medallion and Ral, Monsoon Mage help reduce the cost of spells, while Past in Flames allows you to recast spells from your graveyard. The deck also utilizes cards like Manamorphose and Reckless Impulse to draw additional cards and maintain momentum in order to execute the combo efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly playing small artifacts to trigger the affinity mechanic and overwhelm the opponent with a high number of threats. It also includes cards that can disrupt the opponent's game plan, such as Chalice of the Void and Engineered Explosives. The deck aims to control the board with a mix of aggressive creatures and versatile artifacts, while also having access to some disruption and card advantage through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Salvage Titan. The mana base is optimized to support the artifact-heavy strategy and maintain a consistent card flow.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifact synergy to quickly put pressure on the opponent. By combining cheap artifacts like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble with powerful creatures like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Cori-Steel Cutter, the deck can flood the board with threats early in the game. Cards like Quantum Riddler and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help dig for key pieces while disruption spells like Repeal and Metallic Rebuke can help control the opponent's board. Additionally, the deck utilizes Urza's Saga to ramp up and find important artifacts.

The deck focuses on quickly playing artifacts and creatures to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. It utilizes cards that generate value from artifacts and have synergies with each other, allowing the player to maintain pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Through a combination of efficient creatures, disruptive spells, and powerful artifacts, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive threats. It also includes cards that provide card advantage and allow for tempo plays, allowing the deck to maintain control of the battlefield and outpace the opponent. The main goal is to disrupt the opponent's resources and board presence while establishing a strong board presence of your own, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of efficient aggression and disruptive elements.

This deck focuses on using the combo between Basking Broodscale and Blade of the Bloodchief to create a powerful board presence. By utilizing cards like Kozilek's Command, Malevolent Rumble, and Glaring Fleshraker to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy, the deck aims to quickly ramp into Emrakul, the Promised End and overwhelm the opponent. With efficient mana sources like Eldrazi Temple and Grove of the Burnwillows, as well as card selection from Ancient Stirrings and Vexing Bauble, the deck is designed to execute its game plan smoothly and efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to create a powerful combo without relying on lands. It takes advantage of cards like Disrupting Shoal, Lotus Bloom, and Whir of Invention to quickly assemble pieces for the combo. By utilizing cards like Thundertrap Trainer and Goblin Charbelcher, the deck can deal a significant amount of damage to the opponent in a short amount of time. Additionally, cards like Suppression Ray and Tameshi, Reality Architect help control the opponent's board while setting up for the win condition. This deck focuses on speed and efficiency to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on cycling through creatures and utilizing powerful spells like Living End to clear the board and bring back a team of creatures from the graveyard. By manipulating the graveyard and cycling through cards quickly, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a sudden burst of creatures and disruption. The inclusion of cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety provides additional control and protection, while creatures like Curator of Mysteries and Waker of Waves offer card advantage and pressure. The deck aims to combo off and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and then use reanimation spells like Unearth and Persist to bring them back onto the battlefield for a game-ending combo. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Negation and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with explosive graveyard shenanigans while maintaining card advantage and board control.

The deck focuses on using a combination of cards to quickly assemble a winning board state without relying on traditional lands. It utilizes cards like Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention to search for key pieces like Goblin Charbelcher and Thundertrap Trainer. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Negation and Disrupting Shoal to protect its combo pieces. By combining disruptive elements with powerful combo cards, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory before they can fully develop their own game plan.

The main strategy of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple in order to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths. The deck also focuses on control elements with spells like Malevolent Rumble and Ugin, Eye of the Storms to disrupt opponents and maintain board presence. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Bojuka Bog and Ghost Quarter to interact with the opponent's graveyard and lands, providing additional disruption and control options.

This deck aims to assemble a combo involving Basking Broodscale, Glaring Fleshraker, and Blade of the Bloodchief to generate a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Eldrazi Temple, Urza's Saga, and Ancient Stirrings to search for key pieces and set up the combo quickly. The inclusion of Emrakul, the Promised End provides a strong finisher if the combo doesn't immediately win the game. Overall, the deck focuses on efficient creature synergies and utilizing powerful combo interactions to secure victory.

This deck focuses on creating a powerful combo using Allosaurus Rider to quickly summon Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant to the battlefield. The deck includes various cards that allow for quick creature summoning and searching through the deck, such as Neoform and Eldritch Evolution. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, high-power creature like Ghalta, hopefully securing a swift victory. The deck also includes cards for protection and card advantage, such as Pact of Negation and Consign to Memory.

The main concept of the deck is to generate mana efficiently through cards such as Pyretic Ritual, Manamorphose, and Ruby Medallion, in order to quickly cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames. The deck aims to chain together spells, particularly with the help of Wish cards, to create a storm-like effect and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of powerful spells. Glimpse the Impossible and Reckless Impulse help filter through the deck to find key combo pieces, while Grapeshot provides a finisher to end the game once the combo has been assembled.

This deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with aggressive creatures like Territorial Kavu and Scion of Draco, supported by powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Teferi, Time Raveler. Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact help control the board while cards like Stubborn Denial provide protection. The deck also includes cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and The Legend of Roku for additional aggression. The mana base is designed to provide a consistent mana curve and support a variety of colors for maximum flexibility and versatility in gameplay.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. The deck includes a mix of efficient removal like Fatal Push, versatile counterspells like Counterspell and Force of Negation, and hand disruption like Thoughtseize. The deck also has card advantage engines like Wan Shi Tong, Librarian and Quantum Riddler to help maintain control over the game. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's game plan and outvaluing them in the long run.
